intro: Castilleja aspera, commonly known as the rough castilleja, is a flowering plant in the Orobanchaceae family. It is a hemiparasitic species that attaches to the roots of other plants to obtain some of its nutrients. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and clusters of bright orange to yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Castilleja aspera is native to western North America and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
